chunk_analysis.page_text:
KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That Chancellor L. Jones and Mary A. Jones, husband and wife, and Francis D. Jones and Nellie Jones, husband and wife, the grantors

In consideration of Twelve hundred dollars ($1200.00)
paid by Thomas A. Jones, the grantee

The receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged, do hereby Grant, Bargain, Sell and Convey to the said
Grantee his heirs

All our interest in the following described real estate, namely, the two sevenths of the undivided one half interest in the following described real estate in the Township of Willey, County of Monongalia and state of Ohio, to wit: twenty and 88/100 acres, thirteen and 88/100 acres of which are in the northwest part of the northwest quarter of section twenty-two (22) township two, range two, and seven acres being in the southwest quarter of section eleven (11), township and range aforesaid, beginning at a stone at the northwest corner of said section twenty-two; thence with the line south twenty-three degrees and forty minutes west seventy-four and 85/100 rods to a post in the road; thence north five degrees east seventy four and 85/100 rods to the southeast side of the road; thence south sixty four and three fourths degrees west sixty and 50/100 rods; thence to a post on the road on the west line of section seven; thence at the said line south ten degrees east five and 95/100 rods to place of beginning, containing twenty and 88/100 acres. Also, thirteen acres in said northwest quarter described as follows: beginning at the northwest corner of said quarter; thence east fifty five and one half rods; thence south forty rods; thence west fifty five and one half rods; thence north forty rods to the place of beginning containing fifty acres in the northwest corner of the southwest quarter of section eleven, township two, range two, beginning at the northwest corner of said quarter; thence south one hundred six and two thirds rods; thence south seventy five rods; thence east on the line between sections eleven and twenty to the place of beginning containing seven acres more or less. Also seven and 68/100 acres in the southwest quarter of section eleven township two, range two, beginning on the south line of DeForest land fifty five and one half rods east of the quarter section corner; thence east thirty five rods to the southeast corner of said quarter corner; thence with Cunninghams line south three degrees and thirty eight minutes west forty and 17/100 rods to a stone in the south side of the Washington road; thence along said road south sixty six degrees east twenty nine rods; thence north three degrees and thirty eight minutes east fifty four and 17/100 rods to said DeForest line; thence with said line south eighty seven degrees east thirty seven rods to place of beginning, containing seven and 68/100 acres more or less. Excepting therefrom the coal and mining rights reserved by F. M. Jones and recorded in Deed Book 119, page 522, to which deed reference is made, said land being in Clay District, Monongalia County, West Virginia.

[Standard deed language regarding privileges and appurtenances follows]

Signed by:
Chancellor L. Jones
Mary A. Jones
Francis D. Jones
Nellie Jones

Witnessed by:
Elias C. Tennant
Elias C. Tennant
Elias C. Tennant
Elias C. Tennant

Dated: March, 1914
Filed Dec. 12, 1916 at 9:40 A.M.
Recorded Dec.12, 1916
Fee 50¢

Notary: Elias C. Tennant
Commission expires Dec. 18, 1919
